Browse the source code of codebrowser/gtsam/3rdparty/cephes/cephes/stdtr.c

1/* stdtr.c
2 *
3 * Student's t distribution
4 *
5 *
6 *
7 * SYNOPSIS:
8 *
9 * double t, stdtr();
10 * short k;
11 *
12 * y = stdtr( k, t );
13 *
14 *
15 * DESCRIPTION:
16 *
17 * Computes the integral from minus infinity to t of the Student
18 * t distribution with integer k > 0 degrees of freedom:
19 *
20 * t
21 * -
22 * | |
23 * - | 2 -(k+1)/2
24 * | ( (k+1)/2 ) | ( x )
25 * ---------------------- | ( 1 + --- ) dx
26 * - | ( k )
27 * sqrt( k pi ) | ( k/2 ) |
28 * | |
29 * -
30 * -inf.
31 *
32 * Relation to incomplete beta integral:
33 *
34 * 1 - stdtr(k,t) = 0.5 * incbet( k/2, 1/2, z )
35 * where
36 * z = k/(k + t**2).
37 *
38 * For t < -2, this is the method of computation. For higher t,
39 * a direct method is derived from integration by parts.
40 * Since the function is symmetric about t=0, the area under the
41 * right tail of the density is found by calling the function
42 * with -t instead of t.
43 *
44 * ACCURACY:
45 *
46 * Tested at random 1 <= k <= 25. The "domain" refers to t.
47 * Relative error:
48 * arithmetic domain # trials peak rms
49 * IEEE -100,-2 50000 5.9e-15 1.4e-15
50 * IEEE -2,100 500000 2.7e-15 4.9e-17
51 */
52
53/* stdtri.c
54 *
55 * Functional inverse of Student's t distribution
56 *
57 *
58 *
59 * SYNOPSIS:
60 *
61 * double p, t, stdtri();
62 * int k;
63 *
64 * t = stdtri( k, p );
65 *
66 *
67 * DESCRIPTION:
68 *
69 * Given probability p, finds the argument t such that stdtr(k,t)
70 * is equal to p.
71 *
72 * ACCURACY:
73 *
74 * Tested at random 1 <= k <= 100. The "domain" refers to p:
75 * Relative error:
76 * arithmetic domain # trials peak rms
77 * IEEE .001,.999 25000 5.7e-15 8.0e-16
78 * IEEE 10^-6,.001 25000 2.0e-12 2.9e-14
79 */
80
81
82/*
83 * Cephes Math Library Release 2.3: March, 1995
84 * Copyright 1984, 1987, 1995 by Stephen L. Moshier
85 */
86
87#include "mconf.h"
88#include <float.h>
89
90extern double MACHEP;
91
92double stdtr(int k, double t)
93{
94 double x, rk, z, f, tz, p, xsqk;
95 int j;
96
97 if (k <= 0) {
98 sf_error(func_name: "stdtr", code: SF_ERROR_DOMAIN, NULL);
99 return (NAN);
100 }
101
102 if (t == 0)
103 return (0.5);
104
105 if (t < -2.0) {
106 rk = k;
107 z = rk / (rk + t * t);
108 p = 0.5 * incbet(aa: 0.5 * rk, bb: 0.5, xx: z);
109 return (p);
110 }
111
112 /* compute integral from -t to + t */
113
114 if (t < 0)
115 x = -t;
116 else
117 x = t;
118
119 rk = k; /* degrees of freedom */
120 z = 1.0 + (x * x) / rk;
121
122 /* test if k is odd or even */
123 if ((k & 1) != 0) {
124
125 /* computation for odd k */
126
127 xsqk = x / sqrt(x: rk);
128 p = atan(x: xsqk);
129 if (k > 1) {
130 f = 1.0;
131 tz = 1.0;
132 j = 3;
133 while ((j <= (k - 2)) && ((tz / f) > MACHEP)) {
134 tz *= (j - 1) / (z * j);
135 f += tz;
136 j += 2;
137 }
138 p += f * xsqk / z;
139 }
140 p *= 2.0 / M_PI;
141 }
142
143
144 else {
145
146 /* computation for even k */
147
148 f = 1.0;
149 tz = 1.0;
150 j = 2;
151
152 while ((j <= (k - 2)) && ((tz / f) > MACHEP)) {
153 tz *= (j - 1) / (z * j);
154 f += tz;
155 j += 2;
156 }
157 p = f * x / sqrt(x: z * rk);
158 }
159
160 /* common exit */
161
162
163 if (t < 0)
164 p = -p; /* note destruction of relative accuracy */
165
166 p = 0.5 + 0.5 * p;
167 return (p);
168}
169
170double stdtri(int k, double p)
171{
172 double t, rk, z;
173 int rflg;
174
175 if (k <= 0 || p <= 0.0 || p >= 1.0) {
176 sf_error(func_name: "stdtri", code: SF_ERROR_DOMAIN, NULL);
177 return (NAN);
178 }
179
180 rk = k;
181
182 if (p > 0.25 && p < 0.75) {
183 if (p == 0.5)
184 return (0.0);
185 z = 1.0 - 2.0 * p;
186 z = incbi(aa: 0.5, bb: 0.5 * rk, yy0: fabs(x: z));
187 t = sqrt(x: rk * z / (1.0 - z));
188 if (p < 0.5)
189 t = -t;
190 return (t);
191 }
192 rflg = -1;
193 if (p >= 0.5) {
194 p = 1.0 - p;
195 rflg = 1;
196 }
197 z = incbi(aa: 0.5 * rk, bb: 0.5, yy0: 2.0 * p);
198
199 if (DBL_MAX * z < rk)
200 return (rflg * INFINITY);
201 t = sqrt(x: rk / z - rk);
202 return (rflg * t);
203}
